Key Arguments: The submission process is seen as a smokescreen, with the government likely to engage with select stakeholders outside of public submissions.
The government has previously suppressed narratives that contradict its own, particularly during the pandemic.
The exclusion of mainstream media and government content from the legislation is questioned.
Concerns about the government's influence over social media companies and the suppression of dissenting views.
The legislation could lead to restrictions on freedom of speech and is seen as a move towards authoritarian governance.
Main Themes: Distrust in government processes and intentions
Suppression of alternative narratives and critical thinking
Concerns about media and government exemptions
Freedom of speech and democratic rights
Notable Quotes: I found the behaviour of this/that Department deceiving and believe that this submission process as a smokescreen to what the government wants to achieve.
The right to protest removed, Human rights violations, the use of so called 'LRAD' devices on peaceful protesters...
Somehow a narrative was developed and information outside the narrative would be shutdown.
Stick this bill in the bin!!!!!!!
